com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.file

Interface DataWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteWriter, EncryptedFileWriter, SimpleFileWriter

    public interface DataWriter
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Common interface for writing data to some medium.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the output medium (i.e., it's a file) if necessary.
      boolean isEncryptedWriter() 
      long position()
      Optional method for getting the current position of the file if the writer is backed by a random access file.
      void position(long position)
      Optional method for setting the position of the file if the writer is backed by a random access file.
      int write(byte[] bytes)
      Writes out the provided bytes to whatever the output medium is.
      int write(byte[] bytes, int offset, int length)
      Writes out the provided bytes to whatever the output medium is.
      int write(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
      Writes out the provided byte buffer to whatever the output medium is.

    • Method Detail

      • isEncryptedWriter

        boolean isEncryptedWriter()
        Returns:
        True if the writer is an encrypted writer or not. This is useful if different logic regarding how data is written to the file should be used if the data will be encrypted.

      • position

        void position(long position)
       throws java.io.IOException

        Optional method for setting the position of the file if the writer is backed by a random access file. Otherwise, this may throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the implementing class cannot support this feature.

        For example, for encrypted writers, it may not make sense to set the position since it may screw up the encryption if block chaining is being used.

        Parameters:
        position - The position (bytes) in the file to set the file cursor to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO error occurred while setting the file position.

      • position

        long position()
       throws java.io.IOException

        Optional

        method for getting the current position of the file if the writer is backed by a random access file. Otherwise, this may throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the implementing class cannot support this feature.

        Usually, this should be implemented if position(long) has been implemented.

        Returns:
        The current position (in bytes) of the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO error occurred while getting the file position.

      • write

        int write(@NonNull
          byte[] bytes,
          int offset,
          int length)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out the provided bytes to whatever the output medium is.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to write.
        offset - The offset to start the write from.
        length - The number of bytes to write out.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes that were written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO error occurred while writing the data.

      • write

        int write(@NonNull
          byte[] bytes)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out the provided bytes to whatever the output medium is. This is the equivalent of calling write(byte[], int, int) with the offset set to 0 and the length set to the byte array length.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to write.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes that were written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO error occurred while writing the data.

      • write

        int write(@NonNull
          java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out the provided byte buffer to whatever the output medium is.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The byte buffer to write out.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes that were written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO error occurred while writing the data.

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the output medium (i.e., it's a file) if necessary.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO error occurred during the close operation.
